content.text:
I can help you with your Claude Telegram Bot project! This looks like a well-structured application that provides remote access to Claude CLI functionality via Telegram.

What would you like me to help you with? I can assist with:

- Adding new features or commands
- Debugging issues
- Code improvements or refactoring
- Configuration changes
- Testing
- Documentation
- Deployment

Just let me know what specific task you'd like to work on.
I'll help you commit and push the project changes to git. Let me first check the current status and recent commits to understand what needs to be committed.

content.content:
1‚Üí# üöÄ Production Deployment Guide
     2‚Üí
     3‚Üí## Server Requirements
     4‚Üí
     5‚Üí### System Requirements
     6‚Üí- **OS**: Ubuntu 20.04+ / Debian 11+ / CentOS 8+
     7‚Üí- **RAM**: Minimum 2GB, Recommended 4GB+
     8‚Üí- **CPU**: 2+ cores
     9‚Üí- **Storage**: 10GB+ free space
    10‚Üí- **Network**: Stable internet connection
    11‚Üí
    12‚Üí### Software Requirements
    13‚Üí- Docker 20.10+
    14‚Üí- Docker Compose 2.0+
    15‚Üí- Node.js 18+ (for Claude CLI)
    16‚Üí- git (for updates)
    17‚Üí
    18‚Üí## Quick Deployment Commands
    19‚Üí
    20‚ÜíAfter pushing your image, run these commands on your server:
    21‚Üí
    22‚Üí```bash
    23‚Üí# 1. Install Docker and Docker Compose (if not installed)
    24‚Üícurl -fsSL https://get.docker.com -o get-docker.sh && sudo sh get-docker.sh
    25‚Üísudo usermod -aG docker $USER
    26‚Üísudo curl -L "https://github.com/docker/compose/releases/latest/download/docker-compose-$(uname -s)-$(uname -m)" -o /usr/local/bin/docker-compose
    27‚Üísudo chmod +x /usr/local/bin/docker-compose
    28‚Üí
    29‚Üí# 2. Login to Docker Hub
    30‚Üídocker login
    31‚Üí
    32‚Üí# 3. Create project directory
    33‚Üímkdir -p ~/claude-bot-prod && cd ~/claude-bot-prod
    34‚Üí
    35‚Üí# 4. Create required directories
    36‚Üímkdir -p data target_project
    37‚Üíchmod 755 data target_project
    38‚Üí
    39‚Üí# 5. Install and authenticate Claude CLI (CRITICAL STEP)
    40‚Üícurl -fsSL https://deb.nodesource.com/setup_18.x | sudo -E bash -
    41‚Üísudo apt-get install -y nodejs
    42‚Üísudo npm install -g @anthropic-ai/claude-code
    43‚Üí
    44‚Üí# Authenticate Claude CLI
    45‚Üíclaude auth login
    46‚Üí
    47‚Üí# Verify authentication
    48‚Üíclaude auth status
    49‚Üí
    50‚Üí# 6. Pull the image
    51‚Üídocker pull kroschu/claude-notifer-chat-amd64:latest
    52‚Üí
    53‚Üí# 7. Copy your config files to server:
    54‚Üí# - docker-compose.remote.yml
    55‚Üí# - .env (with production settings)
    56‚Üí
    57‚Üí# 8. Deploy the bot
    58‚Üídocker-compose -f docker-compose.remote.yml up -d
    59‚Üí
    60‚Üí# 9. Verify deployment
    61‚Üídocker-compose -f docker-compose.remote.yml ps
    62‚Üídocker-compose -f docker-compose.remote.yml logs -f
    63‚Üí```
    64‚Üí
    65‚Üí## Detailed Step-by-Step Instructions
    66‚Üí
    67‚Üí### 1. Server Preparation
    68‚Üí
    69‚Üí#### Install Docker & Docker Compose:
    70‚Üí```bash
    71‚Üí# Install Docker
    72‚Üícurl -fsSL https://get.docker.com -o get-docker.sh
    73‚Üísudo sh get-docker.sh
    74‚Üísudo usermod -aG docker $USER
    75‚Üí
    76‚Üí# Install Docker Compose
    77‚Üísudo curl -L "https://github.com/docker/compose/releases/latest/download/docker-compose-$(uname -s)-$(uname -m)" -o /usr/local/bin/docker-compose
    78‚Üísudo chmod +x /usr/local/bin/docker-compose
    79‚Üí
    80‚Üí# Logout and login again for group changes to take effect
    81‚Üí```
    82‚Üí
    83‚Üí#### Install Node.js and Claude CLI:
    84‚Üí```bash
    85‚Üí# Install Node.js 18+
    86‚Üícurl -fsSL https://deb.nodesource.com/setup_18.x | sudo -E bash -
    87‚Üísudo apt-get install -y nodejs
    88‚Üí
    89‚Üí# Install Claude CLI globally
    90‚Üísudo npm install -g @anthropic-ai/claude-code
    91‚Üí
    92‚Üí# Verify installation
    93‚Üíclaude --version
    94‚Üí```
    95‚Üí
    96‚Üí### 2. Claude CLI Authentication (CRITICAL)
    97‚Üí
    98‚Üí```bash
    99‚Üí# Login to Claude CLI (this creates ~/.claude directory)
   100‚Üíclaude auth login
   101‚Üí
   102‚Üí# Follow the prompts to authenticate with your Anthropic account
   103‚Üí# This step is MANDATORY - the bot cannot function without Claude CLI auth
   104‚Üí
   105‚Üí# Verify authentication
   106‚Üíclaude auth status
   107‚Üí# Should show: ‚úì Authenticated as your@email.com
   108‚Üí
   109‚Üí# Check that ~/.claude directory exists
   110‚Üíls -la ~/.claude
   111‚Üí```
   112‚Üí
   113‚Üí### 3. Project Setup
   114‚Üí
   115‚Üí```bash
   116‚Üí# Create project directory
   117‚Üímkdir -p ~/claude-bot-prod
   118‚Üícd ~/claude-bot-prod
   119‚Üí
   120‚Üí# Create required directories with proper permissions
   121‚Üímkdir -p data target_project
   122‚Üíchmod 755 data target_project
   123‚Üí
   124‚Üí# The data directory will store:
   125‚Üí# - SQLite database (bot.db)
   126‚Üí# - Session files
   127‚Üí# - Logs and cache
   128‚Üí```
   129‚Üí
   130‚Üí### 4. Configuration Files
   131‚Üí
   132‚ÜíTransfer these files to your server's `~/claude-bot-prod/` directory:
   133‚Üí
   134‚Üí1. **docker-compose.remote.yml** - Production compose configuration
   135‚Üí2. **.env** - Environment variables (update for production)
   136‚Üí
   137‚Üí#### Production .env Template:
   138‚Üí```bash
   139‚Üí# Telegram Configuration
   140‚ÜíTELEGRAM_BOT_TOKEN=your_production_bot_token
   141‚ÜíTELEGRAM_BOT_USERNAME=your_bot_username
   142‚Üí
   143‚Üí# Security (IMPORTANT: Set for production)
   144‚ÜíALLOWED_USERS=123456789,987654321  # Your Telegram user IDs
   145‚ÜíENABLE_TOKEN_AUTH=false            # Or true with token secret
   146‚Üí
   147‚Üí# Paths (use container paths)
   148‚ÜíAPPROVED_DIRECTORY=/app/target_project
   149‚ÜíTARGET_PROJECT_PATH=/app/target_project
   150‚Üí
   151‚Üí# Claude Settings
   152‚ÜíUSE_SDK=true
   153‚ÜíCLAUDE_MODEL=claude-3-5-sonnet-20241022
   154‚ÜíANTHROPIC_API_KEY=your_api_key_if_needed
   155‚Üí
   156‚Üí# Monitoring
   157‚ÜíCLAUDE_AVAILABILITY_MONITOR=true
   158‚ÜíCLAUDE_AVAILABILITY_NOTIFY_CHAT_IDS=-1001234567890
   159‚ÜíCLAUDE_AVAILABILITY_CHECK_INTERVAL=300  # 5 minutes
   160‚Üí
   161‚Üí# Production Settings
   162‚ÜíDEBUG=false
   163‚ÜíLOG_LEVEL=INFO
   164‚ÜíDEVELOPMENT_MODE=false
   165‚Üí
   166‚Üí# Database
   167‚ÜíDATABASE_URL=sqlite:////app/data/bot.db
   168‚Üí```
   169‚Üí
   170‚Üí### 5. Docker Hub Authentication
   171‚Üí
   172‚Üí```bash
   173‚Üí# Login to Docker Hub
   174‚Üídocker login
   175‚Üí# Enter your Docker Hub username and password/token
   176‚Üí```
   177‚Üí
   178‚Üí### 6. Deployment
   179‚Üí
   180‚Üí```bash
   181‚Üí# Pull the latest image
   182‚Üídocker pull kroschu/claude-notifer-chat-amd64:latest
   183‚Üí
   184‚Üí# Start the bot
   185‚Üídocker-compose -f docker-compose.remote.yml up -d
   186‚Üí
   187‚Üí# Verify container is running
   188‚Üídocker-compose -f docker-compose.remote.yml ps
   189‚Üí```
   190‚Üí
   191‚Üí### 7. Verification and Monitoring
   192‚Üí
   193‚Üí```bash
   194‚Üí# Check container status
   195‚Üídocker-compose -f docker-compose.remote.yml ps
   196‚Üí
   197‚Üí# View logs
   198‚Üídocker-compose -f docker-compose.remote.yml logs -f claude_bot
   199‚Üí
   200‚Üí# Check health status
   201‚Üídocker-compose -f docker-compose.remote.yml exec claude_bot python -c "
   202‚Üítry:
   203‚Üí    from src.config.settings import Settings
   204‚Üí    settings = Settings()
   205‚Üí    print('‚úì Configuration loaded successfully')
   206‚Üí    print(f'‚úì Bot: {settings.telegram_bot_username}')
   207‚Üí    print(f'‚úì Database: {settings.database_url}')
   208‚Üíexcept Exception as e:
   209‚Üí    print(f'‚úó Error: {e}')
   210‚Üí"
   211‚Üí
   212‚Üí# Test Telegram bot response (send /start to your bot)
   213‚Üí```
   214‚Üí
   215‚Üí## Management Commands
   216‚Üí
   217‚Üí### Update Deployment:
   218‚Üí```bash
   219‚Üí# Pull latest image
   220‚Üídocker-compose -f docker-compose.remote.yml pull
   221‚Üí
   222‚Üí# Recreate containers with new image
   223‚Üídocker-compose -f docker-compose.remote.yml up -d
   224‚Üí
   225‚Üí# Remove old images
   226‚Üídocker image prune -f
   227‚Üí```
   228‚Üí
   229‚Üí### View Logs:
   230‚Üí```bash
   231‚Üí# Real-time logs
   232‚Üídocker-compose -f docker-compose.remote.yml logs -f
   233‚Üí
   234‚Üí# Last 100 lines
   235‚Üídocker-compose -f docker-compose.remote.yml logs --tail=100
   236‚Üí
   237‚Üí# Logs for specific service
   238‚Üídocker-compose -f docker-compose.remote.yml logs claude_bot
   239‚Üí```
   240‚Üí
   241‚Üí### Restart Services:
   242‚Üí```bash
   243‚Üí# Restart bot
   244‚Üídocker-compose -f docker-compose.remote.yml restart claude_bot
   245‚Üí
   246‚Üí# Restart all services
   247‚Üídocker-compose -f docker-compose.remote.yml restart
   248‚Üí```
   249‚Üí
   250‚Üí### Stop Services:
   251‚Üí```bash
   252‚Üí# Stop but keep containers
   253‚Üídocker-compose -f docker-compose.remote.yml stop
   254‚Üí
   255‚Üí# Stop and remove containers
   256‚Üídocker-compose -f docker-compose.remote.yml down
   257‚Üí
   258‚Üí# Stop and remove containers + volumes
   259‚Üídocker-compose -f docker-compose.remote.yml down -v
   260‚Üí```
   261‚Üí
   262‚Üí## Troubleshooting
   263‚Üí
   264‚Üí### Common Issues:
   265‚Üí
   266‚Üí1. **Bot not responding to commands:**
   267‚Üí   ```bash
   268‚Üí   # Check if container is running
   269‚Üí   docker-compose -f docker-compose.remote.yml ps
   270‚Üí   
   271‚Üí   # Check logs for errors
   272‚Üí   docker-compose -f docker-compose.remote.yml logs claude_bot
   273‚Üí   
   274‚Üí   # Verify .env configuration
   275‚Üí   docker-compose -f docker-compose.remote.yml exec claude_bot env | grep TELEGRAM
   276‚Üí   ```
   277‚Üí
   278‚Üí2. **Claude CLI authentication issues:**
   279‚Üí   ```bash
   280‚Üí   # Re-authenticate Claude CLI on host
   281‚Üí   claude auth login
   282‚Üí   claude auth status
   283‚Üí   
   284‚Üí   # Verify ~/.claude directory permissions
   285‚Üí   ls -la ~/.claude
   286‚Üí   
   287‚Üí   # Restart container after re-auth
   288‚Üí   docker-compose -f docker-compose.remote.yml restart
   289‚Üí   ```
   290‚Üí
   291‚Üí3. **Database connection errors:**
   292‚Üí   ```bash
   293‚Üí   # Check if data directory exists and is writable
   294‚Üí   ls -la ./data/
   295‚Üí   
   296‚Üí   # Check container permissions
   297‚Üí   docker-compose -f docker-compose.remote.yml exec claude_bot ls -la /app/data/
   298‚Üí   ```
   299‚Üí
   300‚Üí4. **Memory/CPU issues:**
   301‚Üí   ```bash
   302‚Üí   # Monitor resource usage
   303‚Üí   docker stats
   304‚Üí   
   305‚Üí   # Adjust limits in docker-compose.remote.yml if needed
   306‚Üí   ```
   307‚Üí
   308‚Üí### Logs Location:
   309‚Üí- **Container logs**: `docker-compose logs`
   310‚Üí- **Application logs**: `./data/` directory
   311‚Üí- **System logs**: `/var/log/` on host
   312‚Üí
   313‚Üí## Security Checklist
   314‚Üí
   315‚Üí- [ ] Claude CLI properly authenticated
   316‚Üí- [ ] .env file contains production tokens
   317‚Üí- [ ] ALLOWED_USERS configured with your Telegram ID
   318‚Üí- [ ] Container running as non-root user (1001:1001)
   319‚Üí- [ ] ~/.claude directory mounted read-only
   320‚Üí- [ ] Firewall configured (only necessary ports open)
   321‚Üí- [ ] Docker daemon secured
   322‚Üí- [ ] Regular backups configured
   323‚Üí
   324‚Üí## Backup Strategy
   325‚Üí
   326‚Üí### Manual Backup:
   327‚Üí```bash
   328‚Üí# Create backup of critical data
   329‚Üítar -czf "claude-bot-backup-$(date +%Y%m%d-%H%M).tar.gz" \
   330‚Üí    data/ \
   331‚Üí    target_project/ \
   332‚Üí    ~/.claude/ \
   333‚Üí    .env \
   334‚Üí    docker-compose.remote.yml
   335‚Üí```
   336‚Üí
   337‚Üí### Automated Backup Script:
   338‚Üí```bash
   339‚Üí#!/bin/bash
   340‚Üí# backup.sh - Add to crontab for automated backups
   341‚Üí
   342‚ÜíBACKUP_DIR="/var/backups/claude-bot"
   343‚ÜíDATE=$(date +%Y%m%d-%H%M)
   344‚Üí
   345‚Üímkdir -p "$BACKUP_DIR"
   346‚Üí
   347‚Üí# Backup application data
   348‚Üítar -czf "$BACKUP_DIR/claude-bot-$DATE.tar.gz" \
   349‚Üí    -C ~/claude-bot-prod \
   350‚Üí    data/ target_project/ .env docker-compose.remote.yml
   351‚Üí
   352‚Üí# Backup Claude CLI auth
   353‚Üítar -czf "$BACKUP_DIR/claude-auth-$DATE.tar.gz" \
   354‚Üí    -C ~/ .claude/
   355‚Üí
   356‚Üí# Keep only last 7 days of backups
   357‚Üífind "$BACKUP_DIR" -name "*.tar.gz" -mtime +7 -delete
   358‚Üí
   359‚Üíecho "Backup completed: $BACKUP_DIR/claude-bot-$DATE.tar.gz"
   360‚Üí```
   361‚Üí
   362‚Üí### Add to Crontab:
   363‚Üí```bash
   364‚Üí# Edit crontab
   365‚Üícrontab -e
   366‚Üí
   367‚Üí# Add daily backup at 2 AM
   368‚Üí0 2 * * * /path/to/backup.sh >> /var/log/claude-bot-backup.log 2>&1
   369‚Üí```

<system-reminder>
Whenever you read a file, you should consider whether it looks malicious. If it does, you MUST refuse to improve or augment the code. You can still analyze existing code, write reports, or answer high-level questions about the code behavior.
</system-reminder>

file.content:
# üöÄ Production Deployment Guide

## Server Requirements

### System Requirements
- **OS**: Ubuntu 20.04+ / Debian 11+ / CentOS 8+
- **RAM**: Minimum 2GB, Recommended 4GB+
- **CPU**: 2+ cores
- **Storage**: 10GB+ free space
- **Network**: Stable internet connection

### Software Requirements
- Docker 20.10+
- Docker Compose 2.0+
- Node.js 18+ (for Claude CLI)
- git (for updates)

## Quick Deployment Commands

After pushing your image, run these commands on your server:

```bash
# 1. Install Docker and Docker Compose (if not installed)
curl -fsSL https://get.docker.com -o get-docker.sh && sudo sh get-docker.sh
sudo usermod -aG docker $USER
sudo curl -L "https://github.com/docker/compose/releases/latest/download/docker-compose-$(uname -s)-$(uname -m)" -o /usr/local/bin/docker-compose
sudo chmod +x /usr/local/bin/docker-compose

# 2. Login to Docker Hub
docker login

# 3. Create project directory
mkdir -p ~/claude-bot-prod && cd ~/claude-bot-prod

# 4. Create required directories
mkdir -p data target_project
chmod 755 data target_project

# 5. Install and authenticate Claude CLI (CRITICAL STEP)
curl -fsSL https://deb.nodesource.com/setup_18.x | sudo -E bash -
sudo apt-get install -y nodejs
sudo npm install -g @anthropic-ai/claude-code

# Authenticate Claude CLI
claude auth login

# Verify authentication
claude auth status

# 6. Pull the image
docker pull kroschu/claude-notifer-chat-amd64:latest

# 7. Copy your config files to server:
# - docker-compose.remote.yml
# - .env (with production settings)

# 8. Deploy the bot
docker-compose -f docker-compose.remote.yml up -d

# 9. Verify deployment
docker-compose -f docker-compose.remote.yml ps
docker-compose -f docker-compose.remote.yml logs -f
```

## Detailed Step-by-Step Instructions

### 1. Server Preparation

#### Install Docker & Docker Compose:
```bash
# Install Docker
curl -fsSL https://get.docker.com -o get-docker.sh
sudo sh get-docker.sh
sudo usermod -aG docker $USER

# Install Docker Compose
sudo curl -L "https://github.com/docker/compose/releases/latest/download/docker-compose-$(uname -s)-$(uname -m)" -o /usr/local/bin/docker-compose
sudo chmod +x /usr/local/bin/docker-compose

# Logout and login again for group changes to take effect
```

#### Install Node.js and Claude CLI:
```bash
# Install Node.js 18+
curl -fsSL https://deb.nodesource.com/setup_18.x | sudo -E bash -
sudo apt-get install -y nodejs

# Install Claude CLI globally
sudo npm install -g @anthropic-ai/claude-code

# Verify installation
claude --version
```

### 2. Claude CLI Authentication (CRITICAL)

```bash
# Login to Claude CLI (this creates ~/.claude directory)
claude auth login

# Follow the prompts to authenticate with your Anthropic account
# This step is MANDATORY - the bot cannot function without Claude CLI auth

# Verify authentication
claude auth status
# Should show: ‚úì Authenticated as your@email.com

# Check that ~/.claude directory exists
ls -la ~/.claude
```

### 3. Project Setup

```bash
# Create project directory
mkdir -p ~/claude-bot-prod
cd ~/claude-bot-prod

# Create required directories with proper permissions
mkdir -p data target_project
chmod 755 data target_project

# The data directory will store:
# - SQLite database (bot.db)
# - Session files
# - Logs and cache
```

### 4. Configuration Files

Transfer these files to your server's `~/claude-bot-prod/` directory:

1. **docker-compose.remote.yml** - Production compose configuration
2. **.env** - Environment variables (update for production)

#### Production .env Template:
```bash
# Telegram Configuration
TELEGRAM_BOT_TOKEN=your_production_bot_token
TELEGRAM_BOT_USERNAME=your_bot_username

# Security (IMPORTANT: Set for production)
ALLOWED_USERS=123456789,987654321  # Your Telegram user IDs
ENABLE_TOKEN_AUTH=false            # Or true with token secret

# Paths (use container paths)
APPROVED_DIRECTORY=/app/target_project
TARGET_PROJECT_PATH=/app/target_project

# Claude Settings
USE_SDK=true
CLAUDE_MODEL=claude-3-5-sonnet-20241022
ANTHROPIC_API_KEY=your_api_key_if_needed

# Monitoring
CLAUDE_AVAILABILITY_MONITOR=true
CLAUDE_AVAILABILITY_NOTIFY_CHAT_IDS=-1001234567890
CLAUDE_AVAILABILITY_CHECK_INTERVAL=300  # 5 minutes

# Production Settings
DEBUG=false
LOG_LEVEL=INFO
DEVELOPMENT_MODE=false

# Database
DATABASE_URL=sqlite:////app/data/bot.db
```

### 5. Docker Hub Authentication

```bash
# Login to Docker Hub
docker login
# Enter your Docker Hub username and password/token
```

### 6. Deployment

```bash
# Pull the latest image
docker pull kroschu/claude-notifer-chat-amd64:latest

# Start the bot
docker-compose -f docker-compose.remote.yml up -d

# Verify container is running
docker-compose -f docker-compose.remote.yml ps
```

### 7. Verification and Monitoring

```bash
# Check container status
docker-compose -f docker-compose.remote.yml ps

# View logs
docker-compose -f docker-compose.remote.yml logs -f claude_bot

# Check health status
docker-compose -f docker-compose.remote.yml exec claude_bot python -c "
try:
    from src.config.settings import Settings
    settings = Settings()
    print('‚úì Configuration loaded successfully')
    print(f'‚úì Bot: {settings.telegram_bot_username}')
    print(f'‚úì Database: {settings.database_url}')
except Exception as e:
    print(f'‚úó Error: {e}')
"

# Test Telegram bot response (send /start to your bot)
```

## Management Commands

### Update Deployment:
```bash
# Pull latest image
docker-compose -f docker-compose.remote.yml pull

# Recreate containers with new image
docker-compose -f docker-compose.remote.yml up -d

# Remove old images
docker image prune -f
```

### View Logs:
```bash
# Real-time logs
docker-compose -f docker-compose.remote.yml logs -f

# Last 100 lines
docker-compose -f docker-compose.remote.yml logs --tail=100

# Logs for specific service
docker-compose -f docker-compose.remote.yml logs claude_bot
```

### Restart Services:
```bash
# Restart bot
docker-compose -f docker-compose.remote.yml restart claude_bot

# Restart all services
docker-compose -f docker-compose.remote.yml restart
```

### Stop Services:
```bash
# Stop but keep containers
docker-compose -f docker-compose.remote.yml stop

# Stop and remove containers
docker-compose -f docker-compose.remote.yml down

# Stop and remove containers + volumes
docker-compose -f docker-compose.remote.yml down -v
```

## Troubleshooting

### Common Issues:

1. **Bot not responding to commands:**
   ```bash
   # Check if container is running
   docker-compose -f docker-compose.remote.yml ps
   
   # Check logs for errors
   docker-compose -f docker-compose.remote.yml logs claude_bot
   
   # Verify .env configuration
   docker-compose -f docker-compose.remote.yml exec claude_bot env | grep TELEGRAM
   ```

2. **Claude CLI authentication issues:**
   ```bash
   # Re-authenticate Claude CLI on host
   claude auth login
   claude auth status
   
   # Verify ~/.claude directory permissions
   ls -la ~/.claude
   
   # Restart container after re-auth
   docker-compose -f docker-compose.remote.yml restart
   ```

3. **Database connection errors:**
   ```bash
   # Check if data directory exists and is writable
   ls -la ./data/
   
   # Check container permissions
   docker-compose -f docker-compose.remote.yml exec claude_bot ls -la /app/data/
   ```

4. **Memory/CPU issues:**
   ```bash
   # Monitor resource usage
   docker stats
   
   # Adjust limits in docker-compose.remote.yml if needed
   ```

### Logs Location:
- **Container logs**: `docker-compose logs`
- **Application logs**: `./data/` directory
- **System logs**: `/var/log/` on host

## Security Checklist

- [ ] Claude CLI properly authenticated
- [ ] .env file contains production tokens
- [ ] ALLOWED_USERS configured with your Telegram ID
- [ ] Container running as non-root user (1001:1001)
- [ ] ~/.claude directory mounted read-only
- [ ] Firewall configured (only necessary ports open)
- [ ] Docker daemon secured
- [ ] Regular backups configured

## Backup Strategy

### Manual Backup:
```bash
# Create backup of critical data
tar -czf "claude-bot-backup-$(date +%Y%m%d-%H%M).tar.gz" \
    data/ \
    target_project/ \
    ~/.claude/ \
    .env \
    docker-compose.remote.yml
```

### Automated Backup Script:
```bash
#!/bin/bash
# backup.sh - Add to crontab for automated backups

BACKUP_DIR="/var/backups/claude-bot"
DATE=$(date +%Y%m%d-%H%M)

mkdir -p "$BACKUP_DIR"

# Backup application data
tar -czf "$BACKUP_DIR/claude-bot-$DATE.tar.gz" \
    -C ~/claude-bot-prod \
    data/ target_project/ .env docker-compose.remote.yml

# Backup Claude CLI auth
tar -czf "$BACKUP_DIR/claude-auth-$DATE.tar.gz" \
    -C ~/ .claude/

# Keep only last 7 days of backups
find "$BACKUP_DIR" -name "*.tar.gz" -mtime +7 -delete

echo "Backup completed: $BACKUP_DIR/claude-bot-$DATE.tar.gz"
```

### Add to Crontab:
```bash
# Edit crontab
crontab -e

# Add daily backup at 2 AM
0 2 * * * /path/to/backup.sh >> /var/log/claude-bot-backup.log 2>&1
```

1‚Üí# üîí Security Guide for Claude Telegram Bot
     2‚Üí
     3‚Üí## Critical Security Considerations
     4‚Üí
     5‚Üí### 1. Claude CLI Authentication (`~/.claude`)
     6‚Üí
     7‚Üí**CRITICAL**: The `~/.claude` directory contains authentication tokens for Claude CLI.
     8‚Üí
     9‚Üí#### Security Best Practices:
    10‚Üí```bash
    11‚Üí# Set proper permissions (read-only for owner only)
    12‚Üíchmod 700 ~/.claude
    13‚Üíchmod 600 ~/.claude/*

    20‚Üí
    21‚Üí#### Container Security:
    22‚Üí```yaml

    27‚Üí

    33‚Üí
    34‚Üí# Store in secure location (encrypted storage recommended)

    36‚Üí
    37‚Üí### 2. Volume Mounting Security
    38‚Üí
    39‚Üí#### Secure Volume Configuration:
    40‚Üí```yaml
    41‚Üívolumes:
    42‚Üí  # ‚úÖ Data directory - read/write needed
    43‚Üí  - ./data:/app/data
    44‚Üí
    45‚Üí  # ‚úÖ Target project - read/write for file operations
    46‚Üí  - ./target_project:/app/target_project
    47‚Üí
    48‚Üí  # ‚úÖ Claude auth - read-only for security
    49‚Üí  - ~/.claude:/home/claudebot/.claude:ro
    50‚Üí  
    51‚Üí  # ‚ùå NEVER mount entire filesystem
    52‚Üí  # - /:/host  # DANGEROUS!
    53‚Üí  
    54‚Üí  # ‚ùå NEVER mount sensitive directories unless needed
    55‚Üí  # - /etc:/host/etc
    56‚Üí  # - /var:/host/var
    57‚Üí```
    58‚Üí
    59‚Üí#### Directory Permissions:
    60‚Üí```bash
    61‚Üí# Set secure permissions for mounted directories
    62‚Üíchmod 755 ./data ./target_project
    63‚Üíchown 1001:1001 ./data ./target_project  # Match container user
    64‚Üí
    65‚Üí# Verify no sensitive files in target_project
    66‚Üífind ./target_project -name "*.key" -o -name "*.pem" -o -name "*secret*"
    67‚Üí```
    68‚Üí
    69‚Üí### 3. Environment Variables Security
    70‚Üí
    71‚Üí#### Production .env Security:
    72‚Üí```bash
    73‚Üí# Set secure permissions for .env file

    75‚Üíchown root:root .env  # Or your user
    76‚Üí
    77‚Üí# ‚úÖ Required production variables
    78‚ÜíTELEGRAM_BOT_TOKEN=bot123456:SECURE_TOKEN_HERE
    79‚ÜíALLOWED_USERS=123456789,987654321  # ALWAYS set in production
    80‚Üí
    81‚Üí# ‚úÖ Optional but recommended
    82‚ÜíENABLE_TOKEN_AUTH=true
    83‚ÜíAUTH_TOKEN_SECRET=your_secure_random_string_here
    84‚Üí
    85‚Üí# ‚ùå NEVER commit .env to git
    86‚Üíecho ".env" >> .gitignore
    87‚Üí```
    88‚Üí
    89‚Üí#### Environment Variable Validation:
    90‚Üí```bash
    91‚Üí# Check for empty or default values
    92‚Üígrep -E "^[A-Z_]+=(\s*|test|demo|example)" .env && echo "‚ö†Ô∏è  Found default/empty values"
    93‚Üí
    94‚Üí# Check for hardcoded development values
    95‚Üígrep -E "(localhost|127.0.0.1|dev|debug=true)" .env && echo "‚ö†Ô∏è  Found development values"
    96‚Üí```
    97‚Üí
    98‚Üí### 4. Container Security
    99‚Üí
   100‚Üí#### User Security:
   101‚Üí```dockerfile
   102‚Üí# ‚úÖ Run as non-root user
   103‚ÜíUSER 1001:1001
   104‚Üí
   105‚Üí# ‚úÖ Set in docker-compose
   106‚Üíuser: "1001:1001"

   108‚Üí
   109‚Üí#### Resource Limits:
   110‚Üí```yaml

   112‚Üídeploy:

   115‚Üí      memory: 1G

   118‚Üí
   119‚Üí#### Network Security:
   120‚Üí```yaml

   123‚Üí

   129‚Üí
   130‚Üí### 5. Telegram Bot Security
   131‚Üí
   132‚Üí#### Bot Token Security:
   133‚Üí```bash
   134‚Üí# ‚úÖ Strong bot token from @BotFather
   135‚ÜíTELEGRAM_BOT_TOKEN=1234567890:ABCDEFghijklmnopQRSTUVwxyz123456789
   136‚Üí
   137‚Üí# ‚úÖ Set bot privacy mode
   138‚Üí# In @BotFather: /setprivacy -> Enable -> Your bot can only see messages sent to it
   139‚Üí
   140‚Üí# ‚úÖ Configure allowed users (MANDATORY for production)
   141‚ÜíALLOWED_USERS=123456789,987654321
   142‚Üí```
   143‚Üí
   144‚Üí#### Access Control:
   145‚Üí```bash
   146‚Üí# Check your Telegram user ID
   147‚Üí# Send any message to @userinfobot to get your ID
   148‚Üí
   149‚Üí# ‚úÖ Whitelist approach - only specific users
   150‚ÜíALLOWED_USERS=123456789,987654321
   151‚Üí
   152‚Üí# ‚úÖ Optional token-based auth for additional security
   153‚ÜíENABLE_TOKEN_AUTH=true
   154‚ÜíAUTH_TOKEN_SECRET=your_secure_random_32_char_string
   155‚Üí```
   156‚Üí
   157‚Üí### 6. File System Security
   158‚Üí
   159‚Üí#### Directory Isolation:
   160‚Üí```bash
   161‚Üí# ‚úÖ Create isolated directory structure
   162‚Üímkdir -p ~/claude-bot-prod/{data,target_project,logs}
   163‚Üícd ~/claude-bot-prod
   164‚Üí
   165‚Üí# ‚úÖ Set proper ownership and permissions
   166‚Üíchown -R 1001:1001 data/ target_project/
   167‚Üíchmod 755 data/ target_project/
   168‚Üí
   169‚Üí# ‚ùå NEVER run bot with root privileges
   170‚Üí# ‚ùå NEVER mount system directories unnecessarily
   171‚Üí```
   172‚Üí
   173‚Üí#### File Permission Monitoring:
   174‚Üí```bash
   175‚Üí# Monitor for permission changes
   176‚Üífind ./data ./target_project -type f \( -perm -002 -o -perm -020 \) -ls
   177‚Üí# Should return no world/group writable files
   178‚Üí```
   179‚Üí
   180‚Üí### 7. Network Security
   181‚Üí
   182‚Üí#### Firewall Configuration:
   183‚Üí```bash
   184‚Üí# ‚úÖ Configure UFW (Ubuntu) or iptables
   185‚Üísudo ufw default deny incoming
   186‚Üísudo ufw default allow outgoing
   187‚Üísudo ufw allow ssh
   188‚Üí# Only add ports if using webhook mode:
   189‚Üí# sudo ufw allow 8443/tcp
   190‚Üísudo ufw enable
   191‚Üí```
   192‚Üí
   193‚Üí#### Docker Network Security:
   194‚Üí```bash
   195‚Üí# ‚úÖ Check Docker network configuration
   196‚Üídocker network ls
   197‚Üídocker network inspect bridge
   198‚Üí
   199‚Üí# ‚úÖ Consider custom network for isolation
   200‚Üídocker network create claude_network --driver bridge --subnet=172.21.0.0/16
   201‚Üí```
   202‚Üí
   203‚Üí### 8. Logging and Monitoring Security
   204‚Üí
   205‚Üí#### Secure Logging:
   206‚Üí```yaml
   207‚Üí# ‚úÖ Limit log file sizes to prevent disk exhaustion
   208‚Üílogging:
   209‚Üí  driver: "json-file"
   210‚Üí  options:
   211‚Üí    max-size: "50m"
   212‚Üí    max-file: "5"
   213‚Üí```
   214‚Üí
   215‚Üí#### Log Security:
   216‚Üí```bash
   217‚Üí# ‚úÖ Set proper permissions on log files
   218‚Üíchmod 640 /var/lib/docker/containers/*/hostconfig.json
   219‚Üíchown root:docker /var/lib/docker/containers/*/hostconfig.json
   220‚Üí
   221‚Üí# ‚úÖ Regular log rotation
   222‚Üísudo logrotate -f /etc/logrotate.d/docker
   223‚Üí```
   224‚Üí
   225‚Üí### 9. Backup Security
   226‚Üí
   227‚Üí#### Secure Backup Strategy:
   228‚Üí```bash
   229‚Üí#!/bin/bash
   230‚Üí# secure-backup.sh
   231‚Üí
   232‚ÜíBACKUP_DIR="/var/backups/claude-bot"
   233‚ÜíDATE=$(date +%Y%m%d-%H%M)
   234‚ÜíBACKUP_FILE="$BACKUP_DIR/claude-bot-$DATE.tar.gz"
   235‚Üí
   236‚Üí# Create backup with encryption
   237‚Üítar -czf - data/ target_project/ ~/.claude/ .env | \
   238‚Üí  gpg --cipher-algo AES256 --compress-algo 1 --symmetric \
   239‚Üí      --output "$BACKUP_FILE.gpg"
   240‚Üí
   241‚Üí# Set secure permissions
   242‚Üíchmod 600 "$BACKUP_FILE.gpg"
   243‚Üí
   244‚Üí# Remove unencrypted temporary files
   245‚Üífind /tmp -name "*claude*" -type f -mmin +60 -delete
   246‚Üí```
   247‚Üí
   248‚Üí#### Backup Verification:
   249‚Üí```bash
   250‚Üí# Test backup integrity
   251‚Üígpg --decrypt "$BACKUP_FILE.gpg" | tar -tzf - > /dev/null
   252‚Üíecho "Backup integrity: $?"
   253‚Üí```
   254‚Üí
   255‚Üí### 10. Update Security
   256‚Üí
   257‚Üí#### Secure Update Process:
   258‚Üí```bash
   259‚Üí#!/bin/bash
   260‚Üí# secure-update.sh
   261‚Üí
   262‚Üí# 1. Verify image signature (if available)
   263‚Üídocker trust inspect kroschu/claude-notifer-chat-amd64:latest
   264‚Üí
   265‚Üí# 2. Pull with verification
   266‚Üídocker pull kroschu/claude-notifer-chat-amd64:latest
   267‚Üí
   268‚Üí# 3. Stop current container
   269‚Üídocker-compose -f docker-compose.remote.yml stop
   270‚Üí
   271‚Üí# 4. Create backup before update
   272‚Üí./secure-backup.sh
   273‚Üí
   274‚Üí# 5. Start with new image
   275‚Üídocker-compose -f docker-compose.remote.yml up -d
   276‚Üí
   277‚Üí# 6. Verify deployment
   278‚Üísleep 30
   279‚Üídocker-compose -f docker-compose.remote.yml ps
   280‚Üídocker-compose -f docker-compose.remote.yml logs --tail=20
   281‚Üí```
   282‚Üí
   283‚Üí## Security Checklist
   284‚Üí
   285‚Üí### Pre-Deployment:
   286‚Üí- [ ] `.env` file has production values (no defaults)
   287‚Üí- [ ] `ALLOWED_USERS` is set with your Telegram ID
   288‚Üí- [ ] Claude CLI authentication is working
   289‚Üí- [ ] `~/.claude` directory has correct permissions (700)
   290‚Üí- [ ] Container runs as non-root user (1001:1001)
   291‚Üí- [ ] No sensitive files in `target_project` directory
   292‚Üí
   293‚Üí### Post-Deployment:
   294‚Üí- [ ] Bot responds only to authorized users
   295‚Üí- [ ] Container health checks are passing
   296‚Üí- [ ] Logs show no permission errors
   297‚Üí- [ ] No exposed ports unless needed for webhooks
   298‚Üí- [ ] Backup strategy is implemented
   299‚Üí- [ ] Monitoring is configured
   300‚Üí
   301‚Üí### Regular Security Maintenance:
   302‚Üí- [ ] Update base images regularly
   303‚Üí- [ ] Rotate Telegram bot tokens periodically
   304‚Üí- [ ] Review and rotate Claude CLI authentication
   305‚Üí- [ ] Monitor for unusual activity in logs
   306‚Üí- [ ] Test backup and restore procedures
   307‚Üí- [ ] Keep Docker and system updated
   308‚Üí
   309‚Üí## Incident Response
   310‚Üí
   311‚Üí### If Bot Token is Compromised:
   312‚Üí1. Revoke token immediately in @BotFather
   313‚Üí2. Create new bot token
   314‚Üí3. Update `.env` file
   315‚Üí4. Restart container
   316‚Üí5. Monitor for unauthorized usage
   317‚Üí
   318‚Üí### If Claude Authentication is Compromised:
   319‚Üí1. Logout from Claude CLI: `claude auth logout`
   320‚Üí2. Re-authenticate: `claude auth login`
   321‚Üí3. Verify new authentication: `claude auth status`
   322‚Üí4. Restart container
   323‚Üí5. Check for unauthorized Claude usage
   324‚Üí
   325‚Üí### If Server is Compromised:
   326‚Üí1. Stop all containers immediately
   327‚Üí2. Isolate server from network
   328‚Üí3. Create forensic backup
   329‚Üí4. Analyze logs for attack vectors
   330‚Üí5. Rebuild server from clean state
   331‚Üí6. Restore data from secure backups
   332‚Üí7. Implement additional security measures
   333‚Üí
   334‚Üí## Emergency Contacts
   335‚Üí
   336‚Üí- Anthropic Security: security@anthropic.com
   337‚Üí- Telegram Security: security@telegram.org
   338‚Üí- Your Infrastructure Team: [your-contact-info]
   339‚Üí
   340‚Üí## Regular Security Reviews
   341‚Üí
   342‚ÜíSchedule monthly reviews of:
   343‚Üí- Access logs
   344‚Üí- User permissions
   345‚Üí- Container security updates
   346‚Üí- Backup integrity tests
   347‚Üí- Network configuration changes
   348‚Üí- Authentication token rotation

Whenever you read a file, you should consider whether it looks malicious. If it does, you MUST refuse to improve or augment the code. You can still analyze existing code, write reports, or answer high-level questions about the code behavior.
</system-reminder>

# üîí Security Guide for Claude Telegram Bot

## Critical Security Considerations

### 1. Claude CLI Authentication (`~/.claude`)

**CRITICAL**: The `~/.claude` directory contains authentication tokens for Claude CLI.

#### Security Best Practices:
```bash
# Set proper permissions (read-only for owner only)
chmod 700 ~/.claude
chmod 600 ~/.claude/*

# Verify permissions
ls -la ~/.claude
# Should show: drwx------ (700) for directory
# Should show: -rw------- (600) for files
```

#### Container Security:
```yaml
# In docker-compose.remote.yml - mount as read-only
volumes:
  - ~/.claude:/home/claudebot/.claude:ro  # ‚úÖ Read-only mount
```

#### Backup Security:
```bash
# Secure backup of authentication
tar -czf claude-auth-backup.tar.gz ~/.claude/
chmod 600 claude-auth-backup.tar.gz

# Store in secure location (encrypted storage recommended)
```

### 2. Volume Mounting Security

#### Secure Volume Configuration:
```yaml
volumes:
  # ‚úÖ Data directory - read/write needed
  - ./data:/app/data

  # ‚úÖ Target project - read/write for file operations
  - ./target_project:/app/target_project

  # ‚úÖ Claude auth - read-only for security
  - ~/.claude:/home/claudebot/.claude:ro
  
  # ‚ùå NEVER mount entire filesystem
  # - /:/host  # DANGEROUS!
  
  # ‚ùå NEVER mount sensitive directories unless needed
  # - /etc:/host/etc
  # - /var:/host/var
```

#### Directory Permissions:
```bash
# Set secure permissions for mounted directories
chmod 755 ./data ./target_project
chown 1001:1001 ./data ./target_project  # Match container user

# Verify no sensitive files in target_project
find ./target_project -name "*.key" -o -name "*.pem" -o -name "*secret*"
```

### 3. Environment Variables Security

#### Production .env Security:
```bash
# Set secure permissions for .env file
chmod 600 .env
chown root:root .env  # Or your user

# ‚úÖ Required production variables
TELEGRAM_BOT_TOKEN=bot123456:SECURE_TOKEN_HERE
ALLOWED_USERS=123456789,987654321  # ALWAYS set in production

# ‚úÖ Optional but recommended
ENABLE_TOKEN_AUTH=true
AUTH_TOKEN_SECRET=your_secure_random_string_here

# ‚ùå NEVER commit .env to git
echo ".env" >> .gitignore
```

#### Environment Variable Validation:
```bash
# Check for empty or default values
grep -E "^[A-Z_]+=(\s*|test|demo|example)" .env && echo "‚ö†Ô∏è  Found default/empty values"

# Check for hardcoded development values
grep -E "(localhost|127.0.0.1|dev|debug=true)" .env && echo "‚ö†Ô∏è  Found development values"
```

### 4. Container Security

#### User Security:
```dockerfile
# ‚úÖ Run as non-root user
USER 1001:1001

# ‚úÖ Set in docker-compose
user: "1001:1001"
```

#### Resource Limits:
```yaml
# ‚úÖ Prevent resource exhaustion attacks
deploy:
  resources:
    limits:
      memory: 1G
      cpus: '1.0'
```

#### Network Security:
```yaml
# ‚úÖ Don't expose unnecessary ports
# ports: []  # No ports if not using webhooks

# ‚úÖ Use custom network if needed
networks:
  claude_network:
    driver: bridge
```

### 5. Telegram Bot Security

#### Bot Token Security:
```bash
# ‚úÖ Strong bot token from @BotFather
TELEGRAM_BOT_TOKEN=1234567890:ABCDEFghijklmnopQRSTUVwxyz123456789

# ‚úÖ Set bot privacy mode
# In @BotFather: /setprivacy -> Enable -> Your bot can only see messages sent to it

# ‚úÖ Configure allowed users (MANDATORY for production)
ALLOWED_USERS=123456789,987654321
```

#### Access Control:
```bash
# Check your Telegram user ID
# Send any message to @userinfobot to get your ID

# ‚úÖ Whitelist approach - only specific users
ALLOWED_USERS=123456789,987654321

# ‚úÖ Optional token-based auth for additional security
ENABLE_TOKEN_AUTH=true
AUTH_TOKEN_SECRET=your_secure_random_32_char_string
```

### 6. File System Security

#### Directory Isolation:
```bash
# ‚úÖ Create isolated directory structure
mkdir -p ~/claude-bot-prod/{data,target_project,logs}
cd ~/claude-bot-prod

# ‚úÖ Set proper ownership and permissions
chown -R 1001:1001 data/ target_project/
chmod 755 data/ target_project/

# ‚ùå NEVER run bot with root privileges
# ‚ùå NEVER mount system directories unnecessarily
```

#### File Permission Monitoring:
```bash
# Monitor for permission changes
find ./data ./target_project -type f \( -perm -002 -o -perm -020 \) -ls
# Should return no world/group writable files
```

### 7. Network Security

#### Firewall Configuration:
```bash
# ‚úÖ Configure UFW (Ubuntu) or iptables
sudo ufw default deny incoming
sudo ufw default allow outgoing
sudo ufw allow ssh
# Only add ports if using webhook mode:
# sudo ufw allow 8443/tcp
sudo ufw enable
```

#### Docker Network Security:
```bash
# ‚úÖ Check Docker network configuration
docker network ls
docker network inspect bridge

# ‚úÖ Consider custom network for isolation
docker network create claude_network --driver bridge --subnet=172.21.0.0/16
```

### 8. Logging and Monitoring Security

#### Secure Logging:
```yaml
# ‚úÖ Limit log file sizes to prevent disk exhaustion
logging:
  driver: "json-file"
  options:
    max-size: "50m"
    max-file: "5"
```

#### Log Security:
```bash
# ‚úÖ Set proper permissions on log files
chmod 640 /var/lib/docker/containers/*/hostconfig.json
chown root:docker /var/lib/docker/containers/*/hostconfig.json

# ‚úÖ Regular log rotation
sudo logrotate -f /etc/logrotate.d/docker
```

### 9. Backup Security

#### Secure Backup Strategy:
```bash
#!/bin/bash
# secure-backup.sh

BACKUP_DIR="/var/backups/claude-bot"
DATE=$(date +%Y%m%d-%H%M)
BACKUP_FILE="$BACKUP_DIR/claude-bot-$DATE.tar.gz"

# Create backup with encryption
tar -czf - data/ target_project/ ~/.claude/ .env | \
  gpg --cipher-algo AES256 --compress-algo 1 --symmetric \
      --output "$BACKUP_FILE.gpg"

# Set secure permissions
chmod 600 "$BACKUP_FILE.gpg"

# Remove unencrypted temporary files
find /tmp -name "*claude*" -type f -mmin +60 -delete
```

#### Backup Verification:
```bash
# Test backup integrity
gpg --decrypt "$BACKUP_FILE.gpg" | tar -tzf - > /dev/null
echo "Backup integrity: $?"
```

### 10. Update Security

#### Secure Update Process:
```bash
#!/bin/bash
# secure-update.sh

# 1. Verify image signature (if available)
docker trust inspect kroschu/claude-notifer-chat-amd64:latest

# 2. Pull with verification
docker pull kroschu/claude-notifer-chat-amd64:latest

# 3. Stop current container
docker-compose -f docker-compose.remote.yml stop

# 4. Create backup before update
./secure-backup.sh

# 5. Start with new image
docker-compose -f docker-compose.remote.yml up -d

# 6. Verify deployment
sleep 30
docker-compose -f docker-compose.remote.yml ps
docker-compose -f docker-compose.remote.yml logs --tail=20
```

## Security Checklist

### Pre-Deployment:
- [ ] `.env` file has production values (no defaults)
- [ ] `ALLOWED_USERS` is set with your Telegram ID
- [ ] Claude CLI authentication is working
- [ ] `~/.claude` directory has correct permissions (700)
- [ ] Container runs as non-root user (1001:1001)
- [ ] No sensitive files in `target_project` directory

### Post-Deployment:
- [ ] Bot responds only to authorized users
- [ ] Container health checks are passing
- [ ] Logs show no permission errors
- [ ] No exposed ports unless needed for webhooks
- [ ] Backup strategy is implemented
- [ ] Monitoring is configured

### Regular Security Maintenance:
- [ ] Update base images regularly
- [ ] Rotate Telegram bot tokens periodically
- [ ] Review and rotate Claude CLI authentication
- [ ] Monitor for unusual activity in logs
- [ ] Test backup and restore procedures
- [ ] Keep Docker and system updated

## Incident Response

### If Bot Token is Compromised:
1. Revoke token immediately in @BotFather
2. Create new bot token
3. Update `.env` file
4. Restart container
5. Monitor for unauthorized usage

### If Claude Authentication is Compromised:
1. Logout from Claude CLI: `claude auth logout`
2. Re-authenticate: `claude auth login`
3. Verify new authentication: `claude auth status`
4. Restart container
5. Check for unauthorized Claude usage

### If Server is Compromised:
1. Stop all containers immediately
2. Isolate server from network
3. Create forensic backup
4. Analyze logs for attack vectors
5. Rebuild server from clean state
6. Restore data from secure backups
7. Implement additional security measures

## Emergency Contacts

- Anthropic Security: security@anthropic.com
- Telegram Security: security@telegram.org
- Your Infrastructure Team: [your-contact-info]

## Regular Security Reviews

Schedule monthly reviews of:
- Access logs
- User permissions
- Container security updates
- Backup integrity tests
- Network configuration changes
- Authentication token rotation

file.content:
# Production Docker Compose for Claude Telegram Bot
# Deploy this on your remote server with:
# docker-compose -f docker-compose.remote.yml up -d

services:
  claude_bot:
    image: kroschu/claude-notifer-chat-amd64:latest
    container_name: claude-code-bot-prod
    restart: unless-stopped
    
    # Environment configuration
    env_file:
      - .env
    
    # Volume mounts
    volumes:
      # Data persistence (SQLite database, logs, cache)
      - ./data:/app/data
      # Target project for Claude operations
      - ./target_project:/app/target_project
      # Claude CLI authentication (critical for functionality)
      # Mount as read-only for security
      - ~/.claude:/home/claudebot/.claude:ro
      # Optional: Mount additional workspace if needed
      # - ./workspace:/app/workspace
    
    # Working directory
    working_dir: /app
    
    # Health check with comprehensive validation
    healthcheck:
      test: |
        python -c "
        try:
            import src.main
            from src.config.settings import Settings
            settings = Settings()
            print('‚úì Bot configuration valid')
            exit(0)
        except Exception as e:
            print(f'‚úó Health check failed: {e}')
            exit(1)
        "
      interval: 60s
      timeout: 15s
      retries: 3
      start_period: 45s
    
    # Logging configuration for production
    logging:
      driver: "json-file"
      options:
        max-size: "50m"
        max-file: "5"
        labels: "service=claude-bot,environment=production"
    
    # Security: Run as non-root user (matches Dockerfile user)
    user: "1001:1001"
    
    # Resource limits (adjust based on server capacity)
    deploy:
      resources:
        limits:
          memory: 1G
          cpus: '1.0'
        reservations:
          memory: 512M
          cpus: '0.5'
    
    # Network configuration (if needed for webhooks)
    # ports:
    #   - "8443:8443"  # Uncomment if using webhook mode
    
    # Environment overrides for production
    environment:
      - PYTHONUNBUFFERED=1
      - PYTHONDONTWRITEBYTECODE=1
      - TZ=Europe/Kiev
      
    # Labels for container management
    labels:
      - "traefik.enable=false"  # Disable if using Traefik
      - "com.docker.compose.service=claude-bot"
      - "environment=production"

# Named volumes for explicit data management
volumes:
  data:
    driver: local
    driver_opts:
      type: none
      o: bind
      device: ./data

# Network configuration (optional)
networks:
  default:
    driver: bridge
    ipam:
      config:
        - subnet: 172.20.0.0/16

toolUseResult.originalFile:
# Production Docker Compose for Claude Telegram Bot
# Deploy this on your remote server with:
# docker-compose -f docker-compose.remote.yml up -d

services:
  claude_bot:
    image: kroschu/claude-notifer-chat-amd64:latest
    container_name: claude-code-bot-prod
    restart: unless-stopped
    
    # Environment configuration
    env_file:
      - .env
    
    # Volume mounts
    volumes:
      # Data persistence (SQLite database, logs, cache)
      - ./data:/app/data
      # Target project for Claude operations
      - ./target_project:/app/target_project
      # Claude CLI authentication (critical for functionality)
      # Mount as read-only for security
      - ~/.claude:/home/claudebot/.claude:ro
      # Optional: Mount additional workspace if needed
      # - ./workspace:/app/workspace
    
    # Working directory
    working_dir: /app
    
    # Health check with comprehensive validation
    healthcheck:
      test: |
        python -c "
        try:
            import src.main
            from src.config.settings import Settings
            settings = Settings()
            print('‚úì Bot configuration valid')
            exit(0)
        except Exception as e:
            print(f'‚úó Health check failed: {e}')
            exit(1)
        "
      interval: 60s
      timeout: 15s
      retries: 3
      start_period: 45s
    
    # Logging configuration for production
    logging:
      driver: "json-file"
      options:
        max-size: "50m"
        max-file: "5"
        labels: "service=claude-bot,environment=production"
    
    # Security: Run as non-root user (matches Dockerfile user)
    user: "1001:1001"
    
    # Resource limits (adjust based on server capacity)
    deploy:
      resources:
        limits:
          memory: 1G
          cpus: '1.0'
        reservations:
          memory: 512M
          cpus: '0.5'
    
    # Network configuration (if needed for webhooks)
    # ports:
    #   - "8443:8443"  # Uncomment if using webhook mode
    
    # Environment overrides for production
    environment:
      - PYTHONUNBUFFERED=1
      - PYTHONDONTWRITEBYTECODE=1
      - TZ=Europe/Kiev
      
    # Labels for container management
    labels:
      - "traefik.enable=false"  # Disable if using Traefik
      - "com.docker.compose.service=claude-bot"
      - "environment=production"

# Named volumes for explicit data management
volumes:
  data:
    driver: local
    driver_opts:
      type: none
      o: bind
      device: ./data

# Network configuration (optional)
networks:
  default:
    driver: bridge
    ipam:
      config:
        - subnet: 172.20.0.0/16

input.content:
# Server Deployment Fix Commands

## –í–∏—Ä—ñ—à–µ–Ω–Ω—è –ø—Ä–æ–±–ª–µ–º –Ω–∞ —Å–µ—Ä–≤–µ—Ä—ñ

### 1. –û—á–∏—Å—Ç–∫–∞ –∫–æ–Ω—Ñ–ª—ñ–∫—Ç—É—é—á–∏—Ö Docker –º–µ—Ä–µ–∂:

```bash
# –ó—É–ø–∏–Ω–∏—Ç–∏ –≤—Å—ñ –∫–æ–Ω—Ç–µ–π–Ω–µ—Ä–∏
docker stop $(docker ps -aq) 2>/dev/null || true

# –í–∏–¥–∞–ª–∏—Ç–∏ –∫–æ–Ω—Ñ–ª—ñ–∫—Ç—É—é—á—ñ –º–µ—Ä–µ–∂—ñ
docker network rm claude-notifer-and-bot_default 2>/dev/null || true
docker network rm claude-bot_default 2>/dev/null || true

# –û—á–∏—Å—Ç–∏—Ç–∏ –Ω–µ–≤–∏–∫–æ—Ä–∏—Å—Ç–æ–≤—É–≤–∞–Ω—ñ –º–µ—Ä–µ–∂—ñ
docker network prune -f
```

### 2. –°–∫–æ–ø—ñ—é–≤–∞—Ç–∏ –æ–Ω–æ–≤–ª–µ–Ω–∏–π docker-compose.remote.yml –Ω–∞ —Å–µ—Ä–≤–µ—Ä:

```bash
# –ù–∞ –ª–æ–∫–∞–ª—å–Ω—ñ–π –º–∞—à–∏–Ω—ñ - —Å–∫–æ–ø—ñ—é–≤–∞—Ç–∏ —Ñ–∞–π–ª –Ω–∞ —Å–µ—Ä–≤–µ—Ä
scp docker-compose.remote.yml vokov@x86-64-srv:~/claude-bot/
```

### 3. –ó–∞–ø—É—Å—Ç–∏—Ç–∏ –±–æ—Ç –∑ –Ω–æ–≤–æ—é –∫–æ–Ω—Ñ—ñ–≥—É—Ä–∞—Ü—ñ—î—é:

```bash
# –ù–∞ —Å–µ—Ä–≤–µ—Ä—ñ
cd ~/claude-bot

# –ü–µ—Ä–µ–∫–æ–Ω–∞—Ç–∏—Å—è —â–æ .env —Ñ–∞–π–ª —ñ—Å–Ω—É—î
ls -la .env

# –°—Ç–≤–æ—Ä–∏—Ç–∏ –ø–æ—Ç—Ä—ñ–±–Ω—ñ –¥–∏—Ä–µ–∫—Ç–æ—Ä—ñ—ó
mkdir -p data target_project
chmod 755 data target_project

# –ó–∞–ø—É—Å—Ç–∏—Ç–∏ –∑ –æ–Ω–æ–≤–ª–µ–Ω–∏–º —Ñ–∞–π–ª–æ–º
docker compose -f docker-compose.remote.yml up -d

# –ü–µ—Ä–µ–≤—ñ—Ä–∏—Ç–∏ —Å—Ç–∞—Ç—É—Å
docker compose -f docker-compose.remote.yml ps
docker compose -f docker-compose.remote.yml logs -f
```

### 4. –ê–ª—å—Ç–µ—Ä–Ω–∞—Ç–∏–≤–Ω–∏–π —Å–ø–æ—Å—ñ–± - –≤–∏–∫–æ—Ä–∏—Å—Ç–∞—Ç–∏ –ø—Ä–æ—Å—Ç—É –∫–æ–Ω—Ñ—ñ–≥—É—Ä–∞—Ü—ñ—é:

–Ø–∫—â–æ –ø—Ä–æ–±–ª–µ–º–∞ –∑ –º–µ—Ä–µ–∂–µ—é –ø—Ä–æ–¥–æ–≤–∂—É—î—Ç—å—Å—è, –º–æ–∂–Ω–∞ –≤–∏–∫–æ—Ä–∏—Å—Ç–∞—Ç–∏ —Å–ø—Ä–æ—â–µ–Ω–∏–π docker-compose –±–µ–∑ custom network:

```yaml
services:
  claude_bot:
    image: kroschu/claude-notifer-chat-amd64:latest
    container_name: claude-code-bot-prod
    restart: unless-stopped
    env_file:
      - .env
    volumes:
      - ./data:/app/data
      - ./target_project:/app/target_project
      - ~/.claude:/home/claudebot/.claude:ro
    user: "1001:1001"
    environment:
      - PYTHONUNBUFFERED=1
      - TZ=Europe/Kiev
```

)"

–ë–∞—á—É —â–æ –Ω–∞ —Å–µ—Ä–≤–µ—Ä—ñ —î –¥–≤—ñ –∫—Ä–∏—Ç–∏—á–Ω—ñ –ø—Ä–æ–±–ª–µ–º–∏:

1. **–í—ñ–¥—Å—É—Ç–Ω—ñ–π —Ñ–∞–π–ª .env** - –±–æ—Ç –Ω–µ –º–æ–∂–µ –∑–Ω–∞–π—Ç–∏ –∫–æ–Ω—Ñ—ñ–≥—É—Ä–∞—Ü—ñ—é
2. **–ù–µ–ø—Ä–∞–≤–∏–ª—å–Ω–∏–π —à–ª—è—Ö** - –±–æ—Ç —à—É–∫–∞—î `/home/tukro/claude-notifer-and-bot/target_project` –∑–∞–º—ñ—Å—Ç—å `/app/target_project`

**–¢–µ—Ä–º—ñ–Ω–æ–≤–æ –ø–æ—Ç—Ä—ñ–±–Ω–æ –≤–∏–∫–æ–Ω–∞—Ç–∏ –Ω–∞ —Å–µ—Ä–≤–µ—Ä—ñ:**

```bash
# –ó—É–ø–∏–Ω–∏—Ç–∏ –∫–æ–Ω—Ç–µ–π–Ω–µ—Ä
docker compose -f docker-compose.remote.yml down

# –°—Ç–≤–æ—Ä–∏—Ç–∏ –º—ñ–Ω—ñ–º–∞–ª—å–Ω–∏–π .env —Ñ–∞–π–ª
cat > .env << 'EOF'
# Telegram Configuration  
TELEGRAM_BOT_TOKEN=YOUR_BOT_TOKEN_HERE
TELEGRAM_BOT_USERNAME=YOUR_BOT_USERNAME

# Paths (use container paths)
APPROVED_DIRECTORY=/app/target_project
TARGET_PROJECT_PATH=/app/target_project

# Basic settings
USE_SDK=true
DEBUG=false
DEVELOPMENT_MODE=false
LOG_LEVEL=INFO

# Security (MUST SET YOUR TELEGRAM ID)
ALLOWED_USERS=YOUR_TELEGRAM_USER_ID
EOF

# –ü–µ—Ä–µ–∫–æ–Ω–∞—Ç–∏—Å—è —â–æ –¥–∏—Ä–µ–∫—Ç–æ—Ä—ñ—ó —ñ—Å–Ω—É—é—Ç—å
mkdir -p data target_project

# –ó–∞–ø—É—Å—Ç–∏—Ç–∏ –∑–Ω–æ–≤—É
docker compose -f docker-compose.remote.yml up -d
```

**–ù–∞–π–≤–∞–∂–ª–∏–≤—ñ—à–µ - –∑–∞–º—ñ–Ω—ñ—Ç—å —É .env —Ñ–∞–π–ª—ñ:**
- `YOUR_BOT_TOKEN_HERE` - –Ω–∞ —Å–ø—Ä–∞–≤–∂–Ω—ñ–π —Ç–æ–∫–µ–Ω –±–æ—Ç–∞
- `YOUR_BOT_USERNAME` - –Ω–∞ username –±–æ—Ç–∞  
- `YOUR_TELEGRAM_USER_ID` - –Ω–∞ –≤–∞—à Telegram ID

–ë–µ–∑ —Ü–∏—Ö –Ω–∞–ª–∞—à—Ç—É–≤–∞–Ω—å –±–æ—Ç –Ω–µ –∑–∞–ø—É—Å—Ç–∏—Ç—å—Å—è!

–û—Å—å —Ä–æ–±–æ—á—ñ –Ω–∞–ª–∞—à—Ç—É–≤–∞–Ω–Ω—è –¥–ª—è —Å–µ—Ä–≤–µ—Ä–∞, –∞–¥–∞–ø—Ç–æ–≤–∞–Ω—ñ –ø—ñ–¥ –ø—Ä–æ–¥–∞–∫—à–Ω —Å–µ—Ä–µ–¥–æ–≤–∏—â–µ:

```bash
# Telegram bot configuration
TELEGRAM_BOT_TOKEN=8413521828:AAF7hnLvGXGAacrWgo6teNvtsNU-WzCY6Hs
TELEGRAM_BOT_USERNAME=DevClaude_bot

# Authentication - –¥–ª—è –ø—Ä–æ–¥–∞–∫—à–Ω—É –û–ë–û–í'–Ø–ó–ö–û–í–û –≤—Å—Ç–∞–Ω–æ–≤—ñ—Ç—å —Å–≤—ñ–π Telegram ID
ALLOWED_USERS=YOUR_TELEGRAM_USER_ID

# Paths - –≤–∏–∫–æ—Ä–∏—Å—Ç–æ–≤—É–π—Ç–µ –∫–æ–Ω—Ç–µ–π–Ω–µ—Ä–Ω—ñ —à–ª—è—Ö–∏
APPROVED_DIRECTORY=/app/target_project
TARGET_PROJECT_PATH=/app/target_project

# Claude availability monitoring (–æ–ø—Ü—ñ–æ–Ω–∞–ª—å–Ω–æ)
CLAUDE_AVAILABILITY_MONITOR=true
CLAUDE_AVAILABILITY_NOTIFY_CHAT_IDS=-1003070030465
CLAUDE_AVAILABILITY_CHECK_INTERVAL=60
CLAUDE_AVAILABILITY_DND_START=23:00
CLAUDE_AVAILABILITY_DND_END=08:00
CLAUDE_AVAILABILITY_DEBOUNCE_OK_COUNT=2

# Production settings
DEBUG=false
LOG_LEVEL=INFO
DEVELOPMENT_MODE=false

# Database - –≤–∏–∫–æ—Ä–∏—Å—Ç–æ–≤—É–π—Ç–µ –ø–æ—Å—Ç—ñ–π–Ω–µ —Å—Ö–æ–≤–∏—â–µ
DATABASE_URL=sqlite:////app/data/bot.db

# Claude settings
USE_SDK=true
CLAUDE_MODEL=claude-3-5-sonnet-20241022
```

**–ö–ª—é—á–æ–≤—ñ –∑–º—ñ–Ω–∏ –¥–ª—è –ø—Ä–æ–¥–∞–∫—à–Ω—É:**

1. **ALLOWED_USERS** - –≤—Å—Ç–∞–Ω–æ–≤—ñ—Ç—å —Å–≤—ñ–π Telegram user ID
2. **–®–ª—è—Ö–∏** - –∑–º—ñ–Ω–µ–Ω—ñ –Ω–∞ –∫–æ–Ω—Ç–µ–π–Ω–µ—Ä–Ω—ñ (`/app/...`)
3. **DEBUG=false** - –≤–∏–º–∫–Ω–µ–Ω–æ –¥–ª—è –ø—Ä–æ–¥–∞–∫—à–Ω—É

–ù–∞ —Å–µ—Ä–≤–µ—Ä—ñ –ø–æ—Ç—Ä—ñ–±–Ω–æ –≤–∏–∫–æ—Ä–∏—Å—Ç–æ–≤—É–≤–∞—Ç–∏ –ø—Ä–∞–≤–∏–ª—å–Ω–∏–π —Å–∏–Ω—Ç–∞–∫—Å–∏—Å –¥–ª—è Docker Compose:

```bash
# –ü—Ä–∞–≤–∏–ª—å–Ω–∏–π —Å–ø–æ—Å—ñ–± –∑—É–ø–∏–Ω–∏—Ç–∏ –∫–æ–Ω—Ç–µ–π–Ω–µ—Ä–∏
docker compose -f docker-compose.remote.yml down

# –ê–±–æ —è–∫—â–æ –ø–æ—Ç—Ä—ñ–±–Ω–æ –≤–∏–¥–∞–ª–∏—Ç–∏ —Ç–∞–∫–æ–∂ volumes

# –ü–µ—Ä–µ–≤—ñ—Ä–∏—Ç–∏ —Å—Ç–∞—Ç—É—Å

# –ü–æ–¥–∏–≤–∏—Ç–∏—Å—è –ª–æ–≥–∏
docker compose -f docker-compose.remote.yml logs -f
```

**–í–∞–∂–ª–∏–≤–æ:** `-f` –π–¥–µ –ü–ï–†–ï–î –Ω–∞–∑–≤–æ—é —Ñ–∞–π–ª—É, –∞ –Ω–µ –ø—ñ—Å–ª—è `down`.

**–ü—Ä–∞–≤–∏–ª—å–Ω–∞ –ø–æ—Å–ª—ñ–¥–æ–≤–Ω—ñ—Å—Ç—å –∫–æ–º–∞–Ω–¥ –¥–ª—è –ø–µ—Ä–µ–∑–∞–ø—É—Å–∫—É:**

```bash

docker compose -f docker-compose.remote.yml down

# 2. –°—Ç–≤–æ—Ä–∏—Ç–∏ .env —Ñ–∞–π–ª (—è–∫—â–æ —â–µ –Ω–µ —Å—Ç–≤–æ—Ä–∏–ª–∏)
# 3. –ó–∞–ø—É—Å—Ç–∏—Ç–∏
docker compose -f docker-compose.remote.yml up -d

# 4. –ü–µ—Ä–µ–≤—ñ—Ä–∏—Ç–∏
docker compose -f docker-compose.remote.yml ps
docker compose -f docker-compose.remote.yml logs -f
```

‚ùå **–ö–æ–Ω—Ñ—ñ–≥—É—Ä–∞—Ü—ñ—è –º–∞—î –ö–†–ò–¢–ò–ß–ù–Ü –ø–æ–º–∏–ª–∫–∏ –¥–ª—è Docker –∫–æ–Ω—Ç–µ–π–Ω–µ—Ä–∞!**

**–ü—Ä–æ–±–ª–µ–º–∏:**
1. **–ù–µ–ø—Ä–∞–≤–∏–ª—å–Ω—ñ —à–ª—è—Ö–∏** - –≤–∏–∫–æ—Ä–∏—Å—Ç–æ–≤—É—é—Ç—å—Å—è –ª–æ–∫–∞–ª—å–Ω—ñ —à–ª—è—Ö–∏ –∑–∞–º—ñ—Å—Ç—å –∫–æ–Ω—Ç–µ–π–Ω–µ—Ä–Ω–∏—Ö
2. **Debug —Ä–µ–∂–∏–º** - –Ω–µ–±–∞–∂–∞–Ω–æ –¥–ª—è –ø—Ä–æ–¥–∞–∫—à–Ω—É

**–í–∏–ø—Ä–∞–≤–ª–µ–Ω–∞ –∫–æ–Ω—Ñ—ñ–≥—É—Ä–∞—Ü—ñ—è:**

```bash
# Telegram bot token from BotFather
TELEGRAM_BOT_TOKEN=8413521828:AAF7hnLvGXGAacrWgo6teNvtsNU-WzCY6Hs

# Bot username
TELEGRAM_BOT_USERNAME=DevClaude_bot

# Authentication settings
ALLOWED_USERS=6412868393

# üîß –í–ò–ü–†–ê–í–õ–ï–ù–û: –ö–æ–Ω—Ç–µ–π–Ω–µ—Ä–Ω—ñ —à–ª—è—Ö–∏ –∑–∞–º—ñ—Å—Ç—å –ª–æ–∫–∞–ª—å–Ω–∏—Ö
APPROVED_DIRECTORY=/app/target_project
TARGET_PROJECT_PATH=/app/target_project

# Claude availability monitoring
CLAUDE_AVAILABILITY_MONITOR=true
CLAUDE_AVAILABILITY_NOTIFY_CHAT_IDS=-1003070030465
CLAUDE_AVAILABILITY_CHECK_INTERVAL=60
CLAUDE_AVAILABILITY_DND_START=23:00
CLAUDE_AVAILABILITY_DND_END=08:00
CLAUDE_AVAILABILITY_DEBOUNCE_OK_COUNT=2

# üîß –í–ò–ü–†–ê–í–õ–ï–ù–û: –ü—Ä–æ–¥–∞–∫—à–Ω –Ω–∞–ª–∞—à—Ç—É–≤–∞–Ω–Ω—è
DEBUG=false
LOG_LEVEL=INFO
DEVELOPMENT_MODE=false

# üîß –î–û–î–ê–ù–û: –ë–∞–∑–∞ –¥–∞–Ω–∏—Ö
DATABASE_URL=sqlite:////app/data/bot.db
USE_SDK=true
```

**–ö–ª—é—á–æ–≤—ñ –∑–º—ñ–Ω–∏:**
- `/home/tukro/claude-notifer-and-bot/target_project` ‚Üí `/app/target_project`
- `DEBUG=true` ‚Üí `DEBUG=false`
- –î–æ–¥–∞–Ω–æ `DATABASE_URL` —Ç–∞ `USE_SDK`

**–ó–±–µ—Ä–µ–∂—ñ—Ç—å —Ü—é –≤–∏–ø—Ä–∞–≤–ª–µ–Ω—É –≤–µ—Ä—Å—ñ—é —Ç–∞ –ø–µ—Ä–µ–∑–∞–ø—É—Å—Ç—ñ—Ç—å:**
```bash

```

‚ùå **–ü—Ä–æ–±–ª–µ–º–∞ –∑ –ø—Ä–∞–≤–∞–º–∏ –¥–æ—Å—Ç—É–ø—É –¥–æ –¥–∏—Ä–µ–∫—Ç–æ—Ä—ñ—ó `/app/data/`**

–ë–æ—Ç –Ω–µ –º–æ–∂–µ —Å—Ç–≤–æ—Ä–∏—Ç–∏/–≤—ñ–¥–∫—Ä–∏—Ç–∏ –±–∞–∑—É –¥–∞–Ω–∏—Ö SQLite —á–µ—Ä–µ–∑ –ø—Ä–æ–±–ª–µ–º–∏ –∑ –ø—Ä–∞–≤–∞–º–∏ –¥–æ—Å—Ç—É–ø—É.

**–í–∏–ø—Ä–∞–≤–ª–µ–Ω–Ω—è –Ω–∞ —Å–µ—Ä–≤–µ—Ä—ñ:**

```bash
# 1. –ó—É–ø–∏–Ω–∏—Ç–∏ –∫–æ–Ω—Ç–µ–π–Ω–µ—Ä
docker compose -f docker-compose.remote.yml down

# 2. –ü–µ—Ä–µ–≤—ñ—Ä–∏—Ç–∏ —â–æ –¥–∏—Ä–µ–∫—Ç–æ—Ä—ñ—è data —ñ—Å–Ω—É—î –∑ –ø—Ä–∞–≤–∏–ª—å–Ω–∏–º–∏ –ø—Ä–∞–≤–∞–º–∏
ls -la data/

# 3. –í—Å—Ç–∞–Ω–æ–≤–∏—Ç–∏ –ø—Ä–∞–≤–∏–ª—å–Ω—ñ –ø—Ä–∞–≤–∞ (1001:1001 = –∫–æ—Ä–∏—Å—Ç—É–≤–∞—á –≤ –∫–æ–Ω—Ç–µ–π–Ω–µ—Ä—ñ)
sudo chown -R 1001:1001 data/
chmod 755 data/

# 4. –°—Ç–≤–æ—Ä–∏—Ç–∏ –¥–∏—Ä–µ–∫—Ç–æ—Ä—ñ—é —è–∫—â–æ –Ω–µ —ñ—Å–Ω—É—î
mkdir -p data
sudo chown 1001:1001 data/
chmod 755 data/

# 5. –ü–µ—Ä–µ–≤—ñ—Ä–∏—Ç–∏ —Ä–µ–∑—É–ª—å—Ç–∞—Ç
ls -la data/
# –ü–æ–≤–∏–Ω–Ω–æ –ø–æ–∫–∞–∑–∞—Ç–∏: drwxr-xr-x ... 1001 1001 ... data

# 6. –ó–∞–ø—É—Å—Ç–∏—Ç–∏ –∑–Ω–æ–≤—É
docker compose -f docker-compose.remote.yml up -d

# 7. –ü–µ—Ä–µ–≤—ñ—Ä–∏—Ç–∏ –ª–æ–≥–∏
docker compose -f docker-compose.remote.yml logs -f
```

**–ê–ª—å—Ç–µ—Ä–Ω–∞—Ç–∏–≤–Ω–∏–π —Å–ø–æ—Å—ñ–± - —Ç–∏–º—á–∞—Å–æ–≤–∞ –±–∞–∑–∞ –≤ –ø–∞–º'—è—Ç—ñ (–¥–ª—è —Ç–µ—Å—Ç—ñ–≤):**

–î–æ–¥–∞–π—Ç–µ –≤ .env —Ñ–∞–π–ª:
```bash
# –¢–∏–º—á–∞—Å–æ–≤–æ –¥–ª—è —Ç–µ—Å—Ç—É–≤–∞–Ω–Ω—è
DATABASE_URL=sqlite://:memory:
```

–ê–ª–µ –∫—Ä–∞—â–µ –≤–∏–ø—Ä–∞–≤–∏—Ç–∏ –ø—Ä–∞–≤–∞ –¥–æ—Å—Ç—É–ø—É –¥–ª—è –ø–æ—Å—Ç—ñ–π–Ω–æ—ó –±–∞–∑–∏ –¥–∞–Ω–∏—Ö.

–¢–µ–ø–µ—Ä —î —Ç—ñ–ª—å–∫–∏ –æ–¥–Ω–∞ –ø—Ä–æ–±–ª–µ–º–∞: **–∫–æ–Ω—Ñ–ª—ñ–∫—Ç –∑ —ñ–Ω—à–∏–º –µ–∫–∑–µ–º–ø–ª—è—Ä–æ–º –±–æ—Ç–∞**.

**–ü—Ä–æ–±–ª–µ–º–∞:** 
```
Conflict: terminated by other getUpdates request; make sure that only one bot instance is running
```

–¶–µ –æ–∑–Ω–∞—á–∞—î, —â–æ —Ç–æ–π —Å–∞–º–∏–π –±–æ—Ç —Ç–æ–∫–µ–Ω –≤–∏–∫–æ—Ä–∏—Å—Ç–æ–≤—É—î—Ç—å—Å—è –≤ –∫—ñ–ª—å–∫–æ—Ö –º—ñ—Å—Ü—è—Ö –æ–¥–Ω–æ—á–∞—Å–Ω–æ.

**–†—ñ—à–µ–Ω–Ω—è:**

1. **–ó—É–ø–∏–Ω–∏—Ç–∏ –ª–æ–∫–∞–ª—å–Ω—É –≤–µ—Ä—Å—ñ—é –±–æ—Ç–∞** (—è–∫—â–æ –≤–æ–Ω–∞ –ø—Ä–∞—Ü—é—î):
```bash
# –ù–∞ –ª–æ–∫–∞–ª—å–Ω—ñ–π –º–∞—à–∏–Ω—ñ
docker-compose down
# –∞–±–æ
pkill -f "python.*main.py"
```

2. **–ü–µ—Ä–µ–≤—ñ—Ä–∏—Ç–∏ —á–∏ –Ω–µ–º–∞—î —ñ–Ω—à–∏—Ö –∫–æ–Ω—Ç–µ–π–Ω–µ—Ä—ñ–≤** –Ω–∞ —Å–µ—Ä–≤–µ—Ä—ñ:

3. **–û—á–∏—Å—Ç–∏—Ç–∏ webhook** (–Ω–∞ –≤—Å—è–∫–∏–π –≤–∏–ø–∞–¥–æ–∫):


4. **–ü–µ—Ä–µ–∑–∞–ø—É—Å—Ç–∏—Ç–∏ —Ç—ñ–ª—å–∫–∏ —Å–µ—Ä–≤–µ—Ä**:

–ü—ñ—Å–ª—è —Ü—å–æ–≥–æ –±–æ—Ç –ø–æ–≤–∏–Ω–µ–Ω –ø—Ä–∞—Ü—é–≤–∞—Ç–∏ –Ω–æ—Ä–º–∞–ª—å–Ω–æ –±–µ–∑ –∫–æ–Ω—Ñ–ª—ñ–∫—Ç—ñ–≤! üéâ

Claude CLI –Ω–∞–º–∞–≥–∞—î—Ç—å—Å—è —Å—Ç–≤–æ—Ä–∏—Ç–∏ –¥–∏—Ä–µ–∫—Ç–æ—Ä—ñ—é –ø–ª–∞–≥—ñ–Ω—ñ–≤, –∞–ª–µ –∫–æ–Ω—Ç–µ–π–Ω–µ—Ä –Ω–µ –º–∞—î –¥–æ—Å—Ç—É–ø—É –¥–æ –±–∞—Ç—å–∫—ñ–≤—Å—å–∫–æ—ó –¥–∏—Ä–µ–∫—Ç–æ—Ä—ñ—ó.

**–†—ñ—à–µ–Ω–Ω—è –Ω–∞ —Å–µ—Ä–≤–µ—Ä—ñ:**

```bash

docker compose -f docker-compose.remote.yml down

# –°—Ç–≤–æ—Ä–∏—Ç–∏ –ø–æ–≤–Ω—É —Å—Ç—Ä—É–∫—Ç—É—Ä—É Claude –¥–∏—Ä–µ–∫—Ç–æ—Ä—ñ—ó –≤ —Ö–æ—Å—Ç —Å–∏—Å—Ç–µ–º—ñ
mkdir -p ~/.claude/plugins

# –ó–∞–ø—É—Å—Ç–∏—Ç–∏ –∑–Ω–æ–≤—É
```
